description: In this quiz, you will learn and review common Chinese greetings such as 'nǐ hǎo' (你好), 'zǎo shàng hǎo' (早上好), and 'xià wǔ hǎo' (下午好).

questions.question: What does 'nǐ hǎo' (你好) mean?
questions.explanation: 'Nǐ hǎo' (你好) is the most common greeting in Chinese, meaning 'Hello'.

questions.question: How do you greet someone in the morning in Chinese?
questions.explanation: 'Zǎo shàng hǎo' (早上好) is used to greet someone in the morning and means 'Good morning'.

questions.question: Which of the following is used to say 'Good afternoon' in Chinese?
questions.explanation: 'Xià wǔ hǎo' (下午好) means 'Good afternoon' and is used to greet someone in the afternoon.

questions.question: If someone says 'Zǎo shàng hǎo' (早上好) to you, what time of day is it?
questions.explanation: 'Zǎo shàng hǎo' (早上好) is a greeting used in the morning.

questions.question: What greeting would you use in the evening?
questions.explanation: 'Wǎn shàng hǎo' (晚上好) is the greeting used in the evening, meaning 'Good evening'.
